lines.text: My money seems to have done you a lot of harm. I didn't mean it that way. I earned it for you... but for your happiness.

Polly, times are changing. I haven't wanted them to. A lot of people think that everything should be different, and they're quite honest about it, but I can't agree with them. I've been a builder, and the world needs builders - planners too, but builders, always builders.
You can tell how a man is doing in Washington by the amount of slander they sling at him.

[On the radio]
The writing is on the wall. So few of us seem able to read it.

[to Polly]
It's just that I want you to know that lots of marriages... well, aren't the way they say in books... but still they're worth fighting for.
It's always been my experience that spring is sort of flat-chested.
I guess a polite marriage is a dead marriage, isn't it.
